meanings.definition: A screen or railing separating the choir or chancel of a church from the nave.
meanings.sent1: The parclose in the church beautifully divided the choir from the nave.
meanings.sent2: During the service, the choir stood behind the parclose, hidden from the congregation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the parclose was a magical barrier, refusing to cross it.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed behind the parclose, a barrier between her and the rest of the world.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the parclose made it a stunning focal point in the church.

meanings.definition: To enclose or separate with a screen or railing.
meanings.sent1: She decided to parclose the garden with a wooden fence to keep the rabbits out.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a thin line to parclose the figure, creating a sense of isolation.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully tried to parclose the ingredients, pretending they were misbehaving.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were parclosed behind a stoic facade, hidden from the world.
meanings.sent5: The walls seemed to parclose the room, creating a cozy and intimate atmosphere.
